title: Salt Cod Puree
introduction: Salt Cod Puree, also known as Brandacujun in Liguria or Baccala Mantecato in the Veneto, is a delightful appetizer or first course commonly served with toasted bread or grilled polenta. This dish combines salt cod or stockfish with potatoes to create a rich, slightly chunky puree that can be enjoyed in various ways.
ingredients: 1 pound soaked boneless salt cod or stockfish
3 medium potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks
1/4 cup finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley
instructions: Prepare the fish, if necessary. Then bring 2 quarts of water to a simmer. Add the fish and cover the pan. Cook 20 to 30 minutes or until the fish is very tender. Remove the fish with a slotted spoon and place it on a plate.

Place the potatoes, garlic, and salt to taste in a medium saucepan with cold water to cover. Cover and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cook until the potatoes are very tender when pierced with a knife. Drain the potatoes, reserving the cooking water.
With a small knife and your fingers, remove and discard any bones and skin from the fish. Place the fish in a food processor or heavy duty mixer and beat until very smooth.
Mash the potatoes and garlic with a ricer or in a food mill or potato masher.
In a large bowl, combine the fish and potatoes. Beat in the oil and salt to taste. Add some of the potato water and beat until light and fluffy. Stir in the parsley.
Scrape the mixture into a serving bowl and drizzle with additional oil. Serve warm with toast.
variations: Leftovers can be reheated in a bowl set over simmering water (or a double boiler).
Alternatively, shape leftovers into small patties, roll them in egg and bread crumbs, and fry them in oil.
